22. Late Night Tales presents Sasha : Scene Delete (Continuous Mix) (01:15:00)



    The first Late Night Tales release of 2016 is a very special project by Sasha.

 Imagine listening to music inspired by Frahm, Richter and Steve Reich, but made by one of the UKâ€™s leading house and techno DJs. Away from the hubbub of the club, the craziness of Ibiza, thereâ€™s a contemplative side to everybody. Forget the beats and the sweat and the billowing anthems; this quiet, undulating, at times pastoral piece is less about songs and anthems and more about texture and atmosphere. â€˜Scene Deleteâ€™ is a side of Sasha youâ€™ve never heard before. 

 "About three years ago, my collaborators David Gardner and ThermalBear and I wrote a song called â€˜Bring On The Nightâ€™. I sent it to Ultraista and within a few days she sent it back with this amazing vocal on, with Nigel Goodrich playing keyboards. We tried to do club mixes but we just couldnâ€™t get it right. So it sat there doing nothing. 

 Tracks like this kept building up, until finally last summer my frustration boiled over. Weâ€™d made so many tunes that I couldnâ€™t remember the names of half of them: What was that thing with a bass sound and a string line? It drove me mental. At the same time as we were logging these tracks, I was listening to the Jon Hopkinsâ€™ Late Night Tales and I thought a lot of the music weâ€™d been working on was in the same vibe. So I sent the music over to Late Night Tales and they really liked it. 

 Initially, I thought weâ€™d just do a Late Night Tales compilation with maybe a few pieces of my own music. But as we went through everything weâ€™d worked on in the last two years, we realised we had about 50 pieces of music. So we started editing and compiling: â€˜Scene Deleteâ€™ is the end result."
